page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF AYMESTREY
page.content: The derivation of the name is from St.Alkmund, through Alkmundstre, Aylmondistre, Aylmintre to Aymestrey. Topography has made the village a ribbon development along the old Roman Road of{Watling Street}and it has a Church, Village Hall, shop with Post Office, garden centre and a pub. Nearby there is an operational quarry and a timber preservation plant. There is no street lighting,one telephone box, a travelling library van calls once a month, a doctor's surgery once a week, one bus service daily Mon-Fri to Leominster and refuse collected fortnightly. The population of the village is 67 incl 14 children, approx 25% born here, 25% born nearby and 50% incomers. The village is an attractive collection of cottages and houses and despite its lack of social amenities a pleasant place to live.
